column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Mr.
#Text=Stanislaus (Grenada): In my 12 years at the\r
#Text=United Nations, this is the first time that I avail myself\r
#Text=of the opportunity to address this body.
#Text=Although I\r
#Text=have spoken many times in other United Nations\r
#Text=forums, I do so today because the item on the Council's\r
#Text=agenda - women, peace and security - is near and\r
#Text=dear to my heart as I approach my fiftieth wedding\r
#Text=anniversary.
#Text=I begin with the premise that the family is the\r
#Text=basis of society and that good family life is inextricably\r
#Text=intertwined with and interwoven into good national\r
#Text=life, which by extension can promote good\r
#Text=international life.
#Text=From time immemorial, much of the\r
#Text=peace and harmony of the human family, especially in\r
#Text=conflict resolution therein, devolves upon the woman\r
#Text=of the house in her natural milieu as peacemaker.
#Text=Here lies a glorious opportunity to involve\r
#Text=women in peacemaking, peace-building and\r
#Text=peacekeeping at the highest level, nationally and\r
#Text=internationally.
#Text=The age-old saying that the hand that\r
#Text=rocks the cradle rules the world remains only a good\r
#Text=adage unless women are brought into the mainstream\r
#Text=of decision-making at the highest political, educational,\r
#Text=social, economic, cultural and other levels.
#Text=Then, and\r
#Text=only then, will the world give credence and substance\r
#Text=to the ancient Chinese proverb that women hold up half\r
#Text=the sky.
#Text=The Fourth World Conference on Women, held in\r
#Text=Beijing in September 1995, drew up the Beijing\r
#Text=Declaration and Programme of Action.
#Text=It contains 12\r
#Text=subject areas, 6 of which are analysed in the United\r
#Text=Nations publication entitled "The World's Women\r
#Text=2000: Trends and Statistics".
#Text=This was issued just\r
#Text=before the twenty-third special session of the General\r
#Text=Assembly in June 2000, entitled "Women 2000:\r
#Text=Gender, Equality, Development and Peace for the\r
#Text=Twenty-First Century".
#Text=The intent was to show the\r
#Text=progress as well as the disparities between women and\r
#Text=men worldwide in health, human rights, political\r
#Text=decision-making, work, education and families.
#Text=Due to time constraints, my delegation will touch\r
#Text=briefly on three subject areas, namely, human rights,\r
#Text=political decision-making and work.
#Text=While progress\r
#Text=has been made, we cannot fail to see that we are still a\r
#Text=long way from attaining the proclaimed goal of\r
#Text=women's rights as human rights, as was discussed in\r
#Text=the Millennium Report, or of equal rights of men and\r
#Text=women affirmed in the Charter, or of everyone, without\r
#Text=discrimination, having the right to equal pay for equal\r
#Text=work, as emphasized in article 23 of the Universal\r
#Text=Declaration of Human Rights.
#Text=Yet, gender imbalance is nowhere more\r
#Text=noticeable than in the workplace, where on average\r
#Text=women earn at least 30 per cent less than men for equal\r
#Text=work.
#Text=Moreover, in the home, where a woman's\r
#Text=domestic role as spouse and mother is so vital to the\r
#Text=well-being of society, her work is always undervalued\r
#Text=and underpaid.
#Text=Unpaid domestic work everywhere is\r
#Text=seen as a woman's responsibility.
#Text=Is it not incongruous that more than 50 years after\r
#Text=the ratification of the Universal Declaration of Human\r
#Text=Rights that the political landscape is still dominated by\r
#Text=men?
#Text=Yet all international instruments and all national\r
#Text=legislatures enshrine the principle of equality between\r
#Text=men and women.
#Text=Men have a responsibility therefore\r
#Text=to help remove the patriarchal dominance in society\r
#Text=and to allow the private virtues of women to go public.
#Text=Indeed, men of quality should never feel threatened by\r
#Text=women for equality.
#Text=Gender equality is predicated upon education of\r
#Text=girls and boys so that they can be empowered\r
#Text=throughout their life in today's globalizing world to\r
#Text=enter the gender mainstream of equal opportunity.
#Text=The\r
#Text=report of the sixth session of the Commission on the\r
#Text=Status of Women, published on 25 March 2002, tells\r
#Text=how far we are from attaining this goal.
#Text=Given the\r
#Text=opportunity for education, women and girls do as well\r
#Text=as men and boys.
#Text=Some even think that women and\r
#Text=girls do better.
#Text=In 1916, psychologist George Stratton of the\r
#Text=University of Southern California described what he\r
#Text=considered - what he considered, remember, not what\r
#Text=I consider - the inherent superiority of the female\r
#Text=brain in seeing the whole picture.
#Text=Writing on feminism\r
#Text=and psychology in Century Magazine, he expressed the\r
#Text=hope that women would dispel masculine illusions\r
#Text=when they took their rightful place in society.
#Text=Men, he said, tend to fix on cogs instead of flesh\r
#Text=and blood.
#Text=Beginning with a generous wonder at\r
#Text=nature, men end up with fascination for the tool, the\r
#Text=scientific instrument.
#Text=They establish governments to\r
#Text=give order to life and then end up coveting the\r
#Text=functions of government more than life.
#Text=The masculine\r
#Text=genius for organization, Stratton said, needs women's\r
#Text=sense of the heart of things, not the trappings.
#Text=I cannot end without recalling from Greek\r
#Text=mythology the resourcefulness, the common sense and\r
#Text=the power of women.
#Text=In Lysistrata, a masterpiece of\r
#Text=comedy written in 411 BC, Aristophanes tells of how,\r
#Text=during the silly and unnecessary Peloponnesian war\r
#Text=between the city-state of Athens and Sparta, the women\r
#Text=ended the military madness and exposed the absurdity\r
#Text=and futility of war by seizing, first, the Acropolis,\r
#Text=which contained the Treasury, then refusing to have\r
#Text=intimate relations with the returning men soldiers.
#Text=Taken together, their actions of seizure and sex strike\r
#Text=brought peace and development in a century very far\r
#Text=away and removed from the twenty-first century.
#Text=Finally, we men serve as the link between home,\r
#Text=where lessons are first taught and learned, and the\r
#Text=wider world, where they are applied in pursuit of peace\r
#Text=and security.
#Text=An ancient Chinese philosopher captured\r
#Text=the contribution of women to peace and security best\r
#Text=when he said:\r
#Text=\r
#Text="If there is light in the soul, there will be\r
#Text=beauty in the person.
